intro: Tectaria falcata, commonly known as the sickle fern, is a species of epiphytic fern belonging to the family Tectariaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive sickle-shaped fronds, which are typically dark green and leathery in texture. The plant thrives in humid tropical environments, often growing on trees or rocks in shaded, moist areas. Its spores are produced in sori that are clustered on the underside of the fronds, and it plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by contributing to nutrient cycling. Tectaria falcata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and is relatively easy to care for in the right conditions.
